key_points: Tiger Woods has left the hospital and returned home three weeks after a severe car crash in Los Angeles, California.
Woods suffered serious leg injuries when his SUV rolled multiple times in Ranchos Palos Verdes.
He was initially taken to Harbor-UCLA Medical Center and then transferred to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center on February 26.
Woods expressed gratitude for the support and medical care he received in a statement posted on Twitter.
The statement emphasized Woods' focus on recovering at home and getting stronger.
Dr. Anish Mahajan described Woods' injuries as "comminuted open fractures affecting both the upper and lower portions of the tibia and fibula bones."
Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva stated there was "no evidence" of Woods being intoxicated or impaired at the time of the crash.
The sheriff declared the incident as purely an accident, ruling out a reckless-driving charge.
The area where Woods crashed is known for being hazardous and has been the site of many accidents, according to locals.
The accident took place early in the morning of February 23, when Woods' Genesis SUV veered off the road.
spokespersons: Dr. Anish Mahajan (Chief Medical Officer, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
